intro: Coccoloba paraguariensis var. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leaf coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are usually bright green and have a smooth texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red fruits. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
